intro: Mesembryanthemum clausum, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a shallow root system and a capacity to store water in its leaves. It typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a popular ornamental plant in dry climates.
